Definition:
In this study, we first provide an original story consisting of exactly 5 sentences. We then provide a new 2nd sentence which makes the original subsequent stoyline (i.e., 3rd, 4th, & 5th sentences) no longer coherent or logical. You need to edit the 3rd, 4th, and/or 5th sentences if necessary to make sure the new storyline is coherent. Please make sure that: You only make minimum edits on the 3rd, 4th, and/or 5th sentences, respectively. If nothing needs to be changed for a sentence, then just copy the original sentence. With your edited sentences, the whole new 5-sentence story is coherent and logical. 
 Things to avoid: . 
 Emphasis & Caution: Sometimes you only need to edit one of the three subsequent sentences, or change only a few words in the subsequent sentences.

Positive Examples.input:
Sentence 1: Harry had a big crush on Mary. 
 Sentence 2: He asked her out on a date one evening. 
 Sentence 3: Mary told him that she wasn't interested. 
 Sentence 4: Harry was saddened by her response. 
 Sentence 5: He became very depressed. 
 New Sentence2: He was too nervous to ask her out on a date.
Positive Examples.output:
Sentence 3: He heard from Mary's friend that she wasn't interested in him. 
 Sentence 4: Harry was saddened by this. 
 Sentence 5: He became very depressed.
Positive Examples.explanation: In this case, you edited only the 3rd and 4th sentences and copied the original 5th sentence
